newsitem.title: MEXICO: MEXICAN DAILY PORT, SHIPPING UPDATE FOR AUG 12.
newsitem.headline: MEXICAN DAILY PORT, SHIPPING UPDATE FOR AUG 12.

text.p: All Mexican ports were open to shipping on Tuesday, the Communications and Transport Ministry (SCT) said in its 1000 local/1500 GMT daily meteorological report.
Tropical storm Hilda was spotted about 570 miles southwest of the Socorro island in the Pacific. The storm was drifting west with winds from 35 to 45 knots (39 to 51 miles/67 to 86 km per hour).
The ministry said it expected the storm will continue to move away from the coast in coming days, and warned ships from sailing in the storm's vicinity.

Tropical winds were sending strong rains and electric storms to the coasts of Oaxaca and Chiapas. Stronger winds and waves were also reported along the northern Pacific coast in Baja California state.
In the Gulf of Mexico, clouds, moderate rains and winds expected later in the day in Veracruz, Tabasco and the Yucatan peninsula.
Showers also expected on the coasts of Quintana Roo, Honduras and Nicaragua because of storms expected to slowly leave the area.
